format: A data frame containing 44 observations on 3 variables.
title: Dyslexia and IQ Predicting Reading Accuracy
description:
Description
Data for assessing the contribution of non-verbal IQ to
children's reading skills in dyslexic and non-dyslexic children.
reference:
The data were collected by Pammer and Kevan (2004) and employed by
Smithson and Verkuilen (2006). The original reading accuracy score was transformed
by Smithson and Verkuilen (2006) so that accuracy is in the open unit
interval (0, 1) and beta regression can be employed. First, the original accuracy
was scaled using the minimal and maximal score (a and b, respectively)
that can be obtained in the test: accuracy1 = (original_accuracy - a) / (b - a)
(a and b are not provided). Subsequently, accuracy was obtained
from accuracy1 by replacing all observations with a value of 1 with 0.99.

parameters.dyslexia:
factor. Is the child dyslexic? (A sum contrast rather
than treatment contrast is employed.)
parameters.accuracy1:
numeric. Unrestricted reading score with a maximum of 1
(see below).
parameters.accuracy:
numeric. Reading score with maximum restricted to be
0.99 rather than 1 (see below).
parameters.iq: numeric. Non-verbal intelligence quotient transformed to z-scores.
